This creates serious problems because they degrade the land, reduce biodiversity, absorb large amounts of water with altered aquifers and, because they are pyrophyte plants, favor forest fires and bring with them pests and diseases that cause the mass application of phytosanitary products, including glyphosate, to decrease the understory load. Furthermore, its expansion not only causes the disappearance of forest masses of high environmental value, but also invades quality agricultural land. It produces a degradation of the landscape and threatens the integrity and survival of elements of the cultural heritage, as demonstrated by the cases of attacks on rock engravings, paleolithic settlements or megalithic monuments. Some of these problems have already been reported by FAO and the Council of Europe debated a few months ago to declare it an invasive species. For this reason, we urge the Commission to include eucalyptus in the list of invasive alien species of concern within the framework of Regulation 2016/1141.

name: Krisztina MORVAI
text: - Mr President, in connection with the EU accession process in Serbia, I organized a public forum in Zenta, which has an 80% Hungarian population. I signed a contract with Zenta City Hall for the advance payment of the room rent, and then on the day of the forum I received a completely shocking administrative stamped decision to ban this forum, citing that such a program was likely to disturb public safety, peace and public order and public morality. . I feel that not only have my rights been violated, but the European Parliament has also been humiliated. I therefore ask Parliament, and for information the Commission, to investigate the case and to see whether this Serbia, with this type of Bolshevik law enforcement, total arbitrariness instead of the rule of law, is suitable for EU accession. I found that it is not just because the human rights of national communities, including Hungarians, are being trampled on. To prove this, I would like to present a detailed, factual report and a photo album in Hungarian for the time being to both the President and the representative of the Commission.

name: Jiří POSPÍŠIL
text: - Mr President, I would like to use this one-minute speech format to point out that I have put a written question to the Commission and that the answer that came to me was very brief - basically as brief as the questions themselves. I would therefore like to point out on this ground that the Commission is not trying too hard to answer our questions. Specifically, these are my questions from February 9 this year, when I asked questions related to the investigation of the business practices of Czech Railways by the European Commission. My questions were directed to procedural matters, by no means did I want to interfere in the investigation itself. That inquiry must be objective and, of course, I want it to be completely objective. On the other hand, the questions that were asked here were influenced by some reports in the Czech press, and unfortunately I did not receive answers to some of these ambiguities. It is therefore difficult for me to inform Czech citizens how the investigation itself is taking place. So please, let's think about the quality of the answers.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: - (IT) Mr President, ladies and gentlemen, a demographic study recently published by Istat reveals the projection of an increasingly less populated, increasingly elderly and increasingly poor Southern Italy. Over the next few decades, Italy will face a sharp decline in population, and the South will suffer above all, which will go from the current 34% to 29%. And it will not be only due to the decline in births, but also to a strong resumption of internal emigration, which will lead the South to lose more than one million inhabitants, especially young people, and 13% of its population of working age in 2065. . I appeal to the Commission to follow up on words with deeds, concretely dealing with the peripheries of Europe through specific and targeted policies. Migration and the aging of the population are nothing more than the result of an economic crisis that has affected everyone, but from which areas far from the markets are struggling to recover. Inclusive and supportive, cohesive and strong, participatory and democratic are nothing more than synonyms that we attribute to a Europe that we would like to leave no one behind.

name: Marek JUREK
text: - Mr Chairman!Today, once again, listening to Guy Verhofstadt representing our Parliament in negotiations with the United Kingdom, we learned that in fact Great Britain - maybe tomorrow and France - outside the EU, than Hungary or Poland, which wants to change the European Union.This position shows that the unity of Europe has become a cliche today.Europe today is not a community of values.Our values are faith and Christian civilization, this is the homeland, national tradition and independence, it is the family and the right of the weakest to life.And we will never give up the primacy of these values.But although Europe is not a community of values today, it could have been and I hope can be a community of fate.This, however, requires respect and solidarity, an attitude that is denied every day by the ideological passion of the current leadership of the European Union.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: - Mr President, Regulation no.458, which aimed at the security of the citizens of the European Union, is completely counterproductive.It caused chaos at the border crossings between the Republic of Slovenia and the Republic of Croatia.We address the security of citizens through an intelligence system, not through excessive controls at border crossings.Such controls are unsustainable, destroying the tourism sector, the transport and transport sector, and especially harming those who cross the border on a daily basis, some perhaps even more than once.I call on the Commission, together with the Government of Croatia and the Government of Slovenia, but also other countries that have such problems, to resolve this situation as soon as possible.We will soon have a full tourist season in Croatia.Much of our economy depends on it.We need citizens who cross the border really safely, but simply cross borders.Targeted controls are the only right solution!

name: Martina ANDERSON
text: – Mr President, 20 years ago I was serving a life sentence in jail and the IRA cessation had collapsed. 20 years ago an inclusive negotiation emerged after the British Conservative Government lost the election and a new administration, along with the political parties and support from the EU and the USA, built the foundations of Ireland’s peace process. I stand here, a former political prisoner released under the terms of the Good Friday Agreement and now, 20 years on, our political process is in serious trouble because of Brexit and because an anti-equality axis was formed by the British Government and by the DUP. I call on this Parliament to support the case for the north of Ireland to secure designated special status within the EU. This cannot be left to the British Government to grant. The Westminster election power grab aims to copper-fasten a hard Brexit, copper-fasten partition, copper-fasten a hard border and hollow out the Good Friday Agreement in all of its parts. This Parliament and the EU cannot allow that to happen because the Good Friday Agreement is an international agreement and it was lodged at the United Nations.

name: Janusz KORWIN-MIKKE
text: - Mr Chairman! I was supposed to talk about the international situation, but due to the speech of my colleague Marek Jurek, I will add a few words on this subject. Well, let's be clear and put a stop to i: the values ​​imposed by the European Union are exactly opposite to the European values. European values ​​that made us dominate the world - European culture was a model for the whole world. Meanwhile, the opposite values ​​recommended by the European Union mean that we are flooded by colonizers from other countries, Europe is dying, there is no economic development, no children are born, because these are exactly opposite values. And we will defend European values ​​against Union values. For example, the abolition of the death penalty is an EU value that is contrary to a European value. The principle of "whoever does not work, let him not eat" was a European value contrary to the Union's, etc., etc. Fifty could be mentioned. We must defend Europe against the Union.

name: José Inácio FARIA
text: - Mr President, in my last speech in Strasbourg, I denounced the usurpation of the functions of the National Assembly and the democratic asphyxiation in Venezuela. After just 21 days and after 10 demonstrations, more than 1,000 Venezuelans have been arrested, of which 71 remain in prison, hundreds have been injured and more than 20 have lost their lives in the clashes and brutal repression by the Bolivarian government. In an attempt to alleviate tension, and following protests across the world, President Maduro, in a theater coup, announces the holding of local elections this year. But, in view of Maduro's demonstrated ability to manipulate electoral acts, and in the current climate of repression, how can we believe that this electoral process can offer any democratic guarantees? What the Venezuelan people demand is the immediate end of the dictatorial regime in Maduro, a government of national salvation and transition, which can face the serious humanitarian crisis created by Maduro and the disarmament of armed groups, the release of political prisoners, the purification public powers and the call for free and democratic elections. No more, no less! This is the will of the courageous people of Venezuela and the Portuguese who accepted the great Venezuelan nation as their second home. It is to all of them that I want to express my solidarity and my unconditional support. Yesterday, Portugal celebrated its Freedom Day, its 25th of April. I hope that tomorrow it will be the Venezuelans' turn to celebrate their day of liberation from the oppressive yoke.

name: Julie WARD
text: – Mr President, human rights in Iran continue to deteriorate with developments that are deeply worrying. On Monday, the Supreme Court reconfirmed the prison sentence of British Iranian citizen Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe. One year on from her arrest, the charges against her are still unknown and her husband and young daughter remain separated. Monday also marked the first anniversary of Swedish-Iranian Doctor Djalali’s imprisonment in Iran, where he faces the death sentence. Other EU-Iranian prisoners suffer in Iranian prisons in violation of their human rights, some of them away from the public eye. All of them must be released without exception. Last week the Iranian government reportedly executed seven prisoners, some of whom were minors when they were convicted, and an eighth man, Peyman Barandah, is due to be executed on 10 May. The EU External Action Service and national foreign ministries must do more to make sure that all EU-Iranian prisoners held in violation of their human rights come back home and that Iran immediately halts all executions.

name: Stanislav POLČÁK
text: - Mr President, I would like to talk about the role of the Council of Europe and its weakened influence, because the Council of Europe is another international organization operating in Europe.He is primarily responsible for the protection of human rights and international cooperation, and thanks to the actions of the Russian Federation, which currently refuses to recognize several of its judgments, the Council of Europe has been weakened to some extent.I want to say that this organization is mainly in charge of human rights and is setting up the famous Strasbourg court.I am convinced that it is a great pity that the European Union has not become a party to the European Convention on Human Rights, and that it would be appropriate for the European Union to consider this step further, that is, to become a party to the European Convention and subsequentlyestablished a mechanism for recognizing Strasbourg judgments at European Union level as well.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: - Mr President, a debate on the situation in Hungary took place in the European Parliament today. Instead of seeing a discussion about solutions and combating authoritarian tendencies, we saw a leader of the European People's Group, Mr. Manfred Weber, who considered it appropriate to have an intervention in which to directly attack Romania and the democratically elected government. Again, my country is being treated with contempt by a political right that cannot accept the outcome of the parliamentary elections. I want to tell the representatives of this political family that we cannot accept to be treated as such. We know that some want to put Romania in the same boat as Hungary and Poland in order to cut our allocated funds. We know that the European people want to change the current political majority in democratically elected Romania. We know that the right wants to cut cohesion funds and build a multi-speed Europe. I am here to tell them that we will fight for a Europe in which all Member States and all citizens, including Romanians, are treated with respect and do not become a political stake for the European political right.

name: Bogusław LIBERADZKI
text: I close the discussion on this item on the agenda.
